nodes.title: 06/29/22 Weekly Meeting 62 Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 62 is happening on Wednesday June 29th, 2022 from 9:00 AM PST(16:00 UTC) - 10:00 AM PST (17:00 UTC)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).
 
We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).
We regularly use the # omi-meeting-chat channel for text chat. 

## Who we are and why we're here:

The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal. 

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

## Agenda

- Volunteer to take notes? Volunteer to record? 
- Welcome newcomers

## Announcements: 

### Working Group Updates:
- [OMI Website update](https://github.com/omigroup/website)
- [Scripting group](https://github.com/omigroup/omi-scripting-group)
  - OMI developer hour
- [glTF Extensions Group](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions)
  - Progress on OMI_ref and authoring extensions
- [Media Group](https://github.com/omigroup/media)
- any others?

### Discussions: 
- Our role with other groups like MSF and do we want to participate as a group in MSF? 
- A new approach to how we ideate around problems, and demo findings! Making it more fun, and more about exploration than the past :)

A number of news journalists are reaching out regarding us and the new standards forum. We should continue our conversation on Wednesday about how we want to engage with other groups. We benefit from collaboration and it's not a us vs "them" scenario. OMIs work matters and were part of something larger. How we Collab with other groups will be a real turning point for Interoperability.

Furthermore, I think we can really shake things up with an experiment. I'd like to see us solve for challenge statements, and compare results. More demo days, less meeting minutes. More experimentation. More fun.

I'd like to use this week's time to have these two discussions. (this is a copy paste from #247)

# Media 
- would like to upgrade tweetshift to premium features 
  - We already have an integration running to our discord channel. So when our community syndicates tweets with our discord the premium features would include a button that enables discord users to click a button to retweet  / engage (direct from the channel)
  - This speeds up our workflow and helps us share stories together!
  - we are limited in terms of resources so automation can help alleviate some of our burden without sacrificing the integrity/consistency of our messaging. 
  - we should also look inward at our processes at ways to speed up decisions related to requests to test premium features from vendors, since (admittedly) this is the third week that media has asked for this. 
- Also seeking feedback related to tweetshift integration as-is. Visit the OMI-Media section of our discord, and engage.

# Community Egagement
- How do we want to engage with other groups? 
- How can we apply this to our stance on officially participating as a group in MSF? 
  - Some of these larger groups require information that  not everyone is comfortable sharing ("real name", address.. etc.) 
  - We may be overthinking it, and we could reach out to Neil and ask directly - what are the actual tangible requirements? "We could just find that out by asking" - humbletim
  - A member proposed voting to see if we are interested 
  - A member proposed we reach out and ask our questions directly. 
  - "I think it would be great to have OMI logo on the MSF page too, showing our support for the effort" 
  - issue: You must have your org email to participate as a member of OMI. 
    - do we implement OMI emails? 
    - does OMI register with admin@omigroup? and then individuals 
  - " I think that we belong at the table, and already have a voice. We have communal capital, and have been doing this together with and without large companies!" 
 
 Decisions: 
 - Does OMI participate as a group in the first July forum? 
 - Does OMI submit our logo as a group? 
 - If individual members of OMI want to register as themselves using OMI as their org, can we get them each gmail accounts if needed?

## Shaking things up: A culture of experimentation and more demos/talks
>Furthermore, I think we can really shake things up with an experiment. I'd like to see us solve for challenge statements, and compare results. More demo days, less meeting minutes. More experimentation. More fun.

### Group thoughts 
- "seems like every week we have someone demoing something amazing" 
  - "rally behind recognizing that and aiming for that"
- Our group decided it would be fun to "do more stuff" 
- A lot of our members have topics and ideas to share already. We could pick a theme each week, or two weeks, and share our experiments and findings. 
- Demos of all kind "not always code!" 
- We could share our findings more often. 

### So what is a good first problem to solve for and experiment? 
- `Avatars`: Next Wednesday lets talk about Avatars

#### Future
- `Portals`: How should they work? What have you experimented with? What has your company been doing lately for portals? Codefrau (Croquet) said "happy to do a deep-dive into the portals I built". 
- `Homespaces` What could interoperable homespace templating look like? Jin suggested doing workshops, and discussions on VTubing, and more. 
- `content portability` 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63426722/176493588-91820c77-1d37-4e37-bc35-868f57817708.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63426722/176493644-943821fc-acdf-4da7-be68-f4beb831ef8a.png)
# Next week we will discuss `Avatar Interoperability`. Its a broad category so bring your findings, your musings, and your suggestions for others!

The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal. 

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

- Volunteer to take notes? Volunteer to record? 
- Welcome newcomers

## Announcements: 

Lean Coffee? Any demos from the community?

Working Group Updates:
- [OMI Website update](https://github.com/omigroup/website)
- [Scripting group](https://github.com/omigroup/omi-scripting-group)
  - OMI developer hour
- [glTF Extensions Group](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions)
  - Progress on OMI_ref and authoring extensions
- [Media Group](https://github.com/omigroup/media)
- any others?
Lets review demos and then lean coffee :)

# Engagement with other groups

@ CrewMetaverse 
and 
https://twitter.com/Metaverse_Forum 
and 
XR Guild

Want to contribute content? 

Content themes: `Open` `Metaverse` `Interoperability`

# Scripting 
- Developer Hour Part III was this week!
  - every other week on Tuesdays

# gLTF group 
- aaronfranke#0001 had a question about the collider extension / physics body extension 
- KHR Audio worked on by the group 
  - seeking feedback 
- visit [gLTF Extensions Working Group](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions) 
- Meets every Thursday at 21:30UTC - 22:30UTC (5:30 - 6:30pm ET)
- contact Fire or Robert

# Media 
- focused on twitter syndication 
- if posting tweets tag open_metaverse related to `#Open` `#Metaverse` `#Interoperability`
https://www.figma.com/file/QsTaCznSY63Dn3NJFnUCzw/Untitled?node-id=0%3A1

# Coffee [on figjam](https://www.figma.com/file/QsTaCznSY63Dn3NJFnUCzw/OMI-lean-coffee-6.22.22?node-id=2%3A193)
## Croquet announces their open source Microverse builder
- https://github.com/croquet/microverse
- https://twitter.com/codefrau/status/1539354935430483968

## Engaging with other groups 

> Do we want to engage as a group, or as individuals in the Metaverse Standards Forum? 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63426722/175302417-2c32350e-be4e-40b5-8cce-450f64b5019c.png)


Strengths:   
* Maintain synergy with others
* maintaining independence
* potential alignment with bigger orgs (different angle)
* No charge to participate

Weaknesses:   
* trademark suggests its not open open 

Opportunities:   
* Chance to champion why the Open Metaverse Matters
* Collaboration opps with other groups

Threats: 
* Potential corruption of major players

Motion was made to continue convo next week and take a vote.

nodes.title: 06/01/22 Weekly Meeting 58 Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 58 is happening on Wednesday June 1st, 2022 from 9:00 AM PST(16:00 UTC) - 10:00 AM PST (17:00 UTC)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).
 
We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).
We regularly use the # omi-meeting-chat channel for text chat. 

## Who we are and why we're here:

The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal. 

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

## Agenda

- Volunteer to take notes? Volunteer to record? 
- Welcome newcomers

## Announcements: 
Any demos or things to share from the community? 

Working Group Updates:
- [OMI Website update](https://github.com/omigroup/website)
  - Blog update
- [Scripting group](https://github.com/omigroup/omi-scripting-group)
  - Second OMI developer hour
- [glTF Extensions Group](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions)
  - Progress on OMI_ref and authoring extensions
- [Media Group](https://github.com/omigroup/media)
- any others?
Elijah with Zesty shared that last week they noticed a 15-20% increase in webxr traffic (mostly due to pico neo 3). More headsets coming online are contributing to an increase overall of traffic.

# Website 

- posts in review
- Blog going on line hopefully soon

# Scripting group - Developer Hour! 
- started off with beginner topics, helping people with normal JS best practices (don't get to do that often!) 
- Dove into computer graphics topics, godot engine topics, threejs topics, and more. 
- Really fun conversation 
- next Dev open hour is in two weeks (bi-weekly)
Consider more open hours for your working groups as well. Design open hour, Avatar open hour, Blender open hour, etc.

# gLTF extensions 
- https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions
- discussing authoring tools for a while 
- found some gaps in gLTF related to using it as an interoperable authoring format 
- proposed OMI-ref which allows embedding other gLTF documents in a gLTF 
- test with a stylized nature pack compiling all assets into a single gLTF, and link to the different pieces of it using the OMI-ref tool. 

Robert said this would work really well for the existing spoke editor, also building a new editor in element. 

Also some new developments with godot engine 
- import/export workflow for hubs content into godot (import spoke assets into godot and use them there) 
- also export quite a few things from godot, getting closer to an interoperable pipeline for importing and exporting 

## Looking for help 
seeking others who want to be involved in the dev and implementation. 

Reminds us that the prior week we were demoing a Lyuma piece for importing and exporting using godot. 

Ant was using spokes media frames as a way to author gLTF content that could be controlled with threejs, replacing those. If you want to replace artwork in a 3d scene, you could easily use that. Spoke needs some way to add gLTF exif data (arbitrary JSON data that can be attached to different nodes in a scene graph) then we could author any sort of content we want using spoke or related tooling. 

RE: KHR audio 
The hubs team got back to us. they are looking to add support, but are in the middle of a refactor. We are blocked on getting in there, but the sentiment is positive so it could be sooner than later.

# Media and Content Strategy Working group
- suggested splitting working group into different streams 
  - content 
  - process automation 
  - PR 
- In the next meeting, Shirley hopes to present draft of how we can connect the dots and maximize the content we put out to some extent. 
- with respect to the progression: One idea was to try and push whatever was published from twitter into one channel so anyone can easily like, share, and get involved with threads on twitter. Shirley found a bot for that and will need help getting it implemented.
# Lets get first blog post published this week!
REVIEW NEXT WEEK! https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/238

# Lean Coffee session from 06/01/22
[OMI-lean-coffee-june-1.pdf](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/files/8863632/OMI-lean-coffee-june-1.pdf)

nodes.body:
# Agenda
- Take inventory of responsibilities and who is responsible for each
- What gaps do we have with these responsibilities?
- Organizational goals for the next 3 months

# Meeting reminders
- Investigate bots
  - We have Carl bot and Apollo
  - Probably get Carl bot set up to get meeting reminders for all the other regularly occurring meetings
  
# Async communication / work
- Still a problem
- Github is underused
- Processes in place but still seen as confusing

# Media
  - Evo and LMB currently responsible for leading that effort
  - Evo has other obligations and realistically can only lead for the next couple months
  - LMB generally focused on media strategy
  - We need content
    - Can enlist help from university media programs
  - Goals are to guide the public conversation about an Open Metaverse
  - Can write content about the projects we're actually working on and the progress we're making. How it effects other industries. etc Ex. physics, audio emitter
  - Set regular times to post a regular update
  
 ## Monthly Newsletter
   - Rolled up updates from the last month of OMI meetings
   - Links to posts from the OMI community
   - Summaries of progress in our working groups
   - Process can start with writing a paragraph per working group / project / event in a github issue which we use to compile into the newsletter
   - Long term we should shift to writing these summaries in WordPress
   - @antpb will be the newsletter editor
   - Working group leaders should submit content for their updates (TODO: fill in the blanks with the people responsible)
     - glTF Working Group
     - Scripting Working Group
     - Media Working Group
     - Website Working Group
     - ...
   
 ## Twitter Content
   - Newsletter
   - Events
   - New working group announcements / calls for participation
   - New specs / proposals within groups / request for feedback
   - Who is responsible for our twitter / mastodon account?
   
 ## Blog Content
  - @LightLodges and @antpb to meet and discuss first blog content

# Organization Administration 
  - Github bot automatically posts to Discord in each corresponding channel
  - @mrmetaverse managing holistic board, message them for any help needed
  
# General Meeting Administration
  - Wednesday general meetings should be led by a rotating group of people
    - @robertlong, @antpb, @LightLodges, @mrmetaverse have volunteered

# Finance
  - Specify process for budgeting
  - Figure out how to get reimbursed / pay for things through Open Collective

# Events
  - Add more community events to our calendar
    - @madjin has been helping update the M3 calendar which we should sync to our calendar somehow
  - knar, Red Eagle,  @mrmetaverse, and @LightLodges have volunteered to lead our next demo night (after June 6th)

# Partnerships / Liaisons
- Discussions about partnerships should happen in public
- We need to be aligned in how we talk to these orgs
- We need to flesh out the interoperator group, code of conduct when acting on behalf of OMI
- We should have people from our group attending other groups meetings as others have done in OMI
- Encourage people to investigate other groups and platforms

# Working Group Administration

  - Create tickets for all actionable items. Working group leaders should be more strict on this.
  - Assign that ticket to to the proper project / column so we can track it (@mrmetaverse manages the holistic OMI board, working groups manage their own board)
  - Weekly agendas / notes need to be taken even if people didn't attend those meetings or nothing on the record was said. That way we can keep track of the health of a group.
  - Website group may want to move to a monthly cadence, most work can be done async

nodes.title: OMI Election - April 20th 2022
nodes.body:
# OMI Election

Hey everyone we're almost at the 1 year anniversary of OMI! Congrats to everyone who has been involved!

In order for us to continue to grow, we need to expand our leadership team. At our meeting on April 20th at 16:00 UTC we'll kick off our election for the leadership team. OMI members will have 24 hours to approve the leadership team on Discord. We'll ping @ everyone when the vote has opened.

### Leadership Team Responsibilities

The OMI leadership team will be responsible for the day to day operations of the OMI organization. This include but are not limited to:

- Media
  - Social Media
  - Blog Writing
  - Media Relations
  - Production / Streaming
- Finance
  - Open Collective / Budget
  - Grant Writing / Fundraising
- Events
  - Welcoming people into the community
  - Demo Nights
  - Lightning Talks
  - Hackathons
  - Workshops / teaching
- Partnerships / Liaisons
  - Khronos glTF Working Group
  - Virtual World liaisons / ambassadors
  - W3C Working Groups
  - M3
  - WebXR Discord
  - XRSI
  - And more!
- General Meeting Administration
  - Recording meetings
  - Meeting agenda
  - Meeting facilitators
- Organization Administration
  - Calendar / scheduling
  - Progress summaries
  - GitHub / Backlog
- Working Group Administration
  - W3C Chairs
  - Spec Editors
  - Working Group leadership

The leadership team will meet once a week for an hour to plan out the week's responsibilities and ensure our tasks are covered. As a member of the leadership team you should have at least one hour a week available to meet with the rest of the leadership team as well as some time to accomplish the various tasks.

Members of the leadership team should have good standing with the [W3C Community Guidelines](https://www.w3.org/Consortium/cepc/) and should be role models for the rest of the community. They will be responsible for upholding these guidelines and fostering the growth of a respectful and inclusive community.

Leadership team members will help steer the community via the responsibilities listed above. However, all decisions within the community will still be made via a vote by consensus. Leaders will not have any more weight than any other member in the voting process. The leadership team is responsible for acting on behalf of the community and should take in and address feedback regularly.

### Election Process

People who are interested in volunteering for the leadership team should comment below **before** April 20th at 16:00 UTC. You may also nominate other members before that time, but they must respond confirming their intention to volunteer for the leadership team.

The election will be held asynchronously, members of the community will have 24 hours to confirm members to the leadership team. Every OMI member will be able to individually vote to confirm each member. Members will be confirmed via a simple majority vote. The voting will happen in Discord and you will be notified by an @everyone ping on April 20th at 16:00 UTC.

The term for this position will be 1 year. We'll hold another election during the meeting closest to that date. If we continue holding our weekly meetings on Wednesdays, the next election will be held on April 19th 2023.

Leadership team members may at any point choose to resign, but we'd ask that volunteers think about how much time they are able to commit before volunteering.

As with any OMI member, if at any point a leadership team member is deemed to have violated the W3C Community Guidelines, we will follow the [process outlined by the W3C](https://www.w3.org/Consortium/cepc/#Reporting). Repeat violations will result in the removal of that leader from their position.

### Nominations

Nominate yourself or others in the comments below. If you have been nominated, please confirm your intent to volunteer.

Thank you everyone for an incredible first year at OMI and here's to many more to come!
:hand: I volunteer to continue my service.

I'd like to continue to volunteer to serve as GLTF Working Group Chair and W3C Chair. I would like to step back a bit from my responsibilities in other areas wherever possible, but totally willing to fill in gaps where needed. In the outline above I really want to focus on:

- Partnerships / Liaisons
- Working Group Administration

And filling in gaps in the following areas:

- General Meeting Administration
- Organization Administration

I'd like to stay active in the GLTF Working Group and am very interested in helping with W3C duties where appropriate. I've had a lot of experience in large open source projects and have always been curious about the standards process. Given my experience over the last several months, I'm very certain it's where I can help and learn the most. Partnerships / Liaisons is another area or opportunity that pairs nicely with these duties where I can help with implementations or relay information to and from groups.

I'd also like to help with blog writing and continue managing the website.

I would like to start by committing to one hour a week assisting with media production and streaming. I am actively working with live streaming volumetric technology, focused on live music and events in built environments. I have a background in audio, video, 2d/3d animation, and solution architecture for carrier-scale application.

✋ I volunteer to service in the areas of:

* Partnerships / Liaisons with Khronos glTF Working Group, Godot Engine and with Virtual Worlds.

I also want to expand OMI towards:

* Media creation to teach learnings from Partnerships / Liaisons.

✋ I volunteer to service in the areas of:

- Welcoming people and creating channels to bring people to OMI
- Calendar / scheduling -- I really think Discord's event system should be front-and-center here and if you agree I would love to help. 
- Discussion events -- I think there is room for a weekly educational event. I used to lead one but for lack of help I shut down for now. Maybe between OMI and P1 we can cover it? 
- Podcasts -- I run one for P1 and I would love to work together if our joint energy can have double the effect. 

Not keen on leading but helping as time is limited. If there are no others helping in areas (such as welcoming) I would like to keep the overhead on the down-low if possible.

✋ I volunteer to service in the areas of:

- Partnerships / Liaisons: with M3 and virtual worlds
- Media: We are making content while live testing avatar interop in M3, can share b-roll and cross-promote since we are sharing feedback and notes with working groups like scripting / gltf-extensions
- Workshops / demo nights: Happy to help facilitate if any are related to avatars

Hi this is Evo - I can facilitate, help guide & continue contributing to organizational development and media teams.

+ Helping refine budgets from planning to production
+ Choosing tech tools and workflows for production and integration with other teams
+ Creating live and hybrid streaming events with global industry allies, collabs internally and with others
+ Assisting in partnership development as part of a team effort, interfacing with public sector orgs (gov and NGO)
+ Currently assisting in posting to & managing social channels including planning to production, moving us to a shared editorial calendar and content pool to collectively publish across channels (decentralize & share social publishing functions with media team)

I contribute to metaverse media reports across fields and industry sectors that this community is also welcome to post & build on for future repos/libraries as useful for new audiences.

I'd also like to work with our community to print up stickers, hoodies and shirts for our contributors this year so we can show up as a community together everywhere across digital and physical worlds alike.

Shadow here, I'd like to help out with the following:

Media
- Blog Writing
- (Maybe) Streaming

Events (Design related)
- Demo Nights
- Lightning Talks
- Hackathons
- Workshops/teaching

Partnerships
- XRSI
- (Maybe) Virtual worlds

Working Group leadership
- Design/Research group (will propose the group in the next week or two)

✋ I volunteer to service in the areas of:
- Media: Blog Writing (in particular would like to see an OMI monthly recap)
- Events: Hackathons / Workshops / teaching
- Partnerships / Liaisons: Open Source project outreach and feedback looping
- General Meeting Administration: Meeting facilitation
- Organization Administration
- Working Group Administration: Helping document successful subgroup processes

After being in the OMI discord for a year now I'm ready to take on a more active role in the organization. I would like to volunteer my time for the following:

- Events
  - Welcoming people into the community
  - Demo Nights
  - Lightning Talks
  - Hackathons
  - Workshops / teaching
- Partnerships / Liaisons
  - Virtual World liaisons / ambassadors
- Organization Administration
  - Calendar / scheduling

On top of this I would like to help bring the OMI Metaverse map into existence and create a working group for it.
All new leaders are added to OMi-Champion role on Discord :checkered_flag:

nodes.title: Let's work on a name for individual nodes of the Metaverse
nodes.body:
The Facebook-Metaverse name change situation made it clear to us that as part of the open metaverse we need to be proactive to name the space in order to ensure it remains in a public and not private orbit. 

Shall we suggest and agree on a name for an individual node within the Metaverse? 

Like a webpage is part of the greater world wide web, let's name one node of the metaverse, come up with the definition and publish it together as OMI (and we at OCEM will help propagate it). 

We need to compromise to make this happen but it's a really small thing. So let's suggest names and let's agree on one together?

I love the concept of metaverse -> metagalaxy -> metaworld, etc. 

I also subscribe to the term Platform, as it still applies in 99% of the cases where someone says they are building _a_ metaverse.

nodes.title: 04/06/22 Weekly Meeting 50 Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 50 is happening on Wednesday April 6th, 2022 from 9:00 AM PST(16:00 UTC) - 10:00 AM PST (17:00 UTC)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).
 
We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).

## Who we are and why we're here:

The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal. 

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

## Agenda

- Volunteer to take notes? Volunteer to record? 
- Welcome newcomers

Working Group Updates:

- OMI Website update
- OMI-Chan group
- Scripting group
- [gLTF group](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions/discussions/76)
- any others?

Workshop Updates:

- Workshop recap
  - Miro Board: https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVOFdPAIQ=/?invite_link_id=889027571587 
- OMI Next Steps

- gltf updates 
- revisit last weeks workshop, add any new thoughts 
- VOTE: proposed minimum requirements for working groups: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/176, related to https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/207
- https://github.com/omigroup/website/issues/39#issuecomment-1089518896
- https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/202#issuecomment-1086878913
- https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/195?notification_referrer_id=NT_kwDOA8fQorMzMjQyNjM4MTUzOjYzNDI2NzIy#issuecomment-1069386501
- Proposed Social media and brand strategy group (part of or replacing Comms): https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/205 forming a proper comms group to manage communications and content planning. This group would need a repo, readme, and backlog. If interested we need to submit an issue proposing the group. At the moment comms and finance and other key pieces of OMI operations are all lumped under Interoperators which may be a risk. 
- Portals group: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/209 I will be submitting a proposal to form an exploratory group for portals in the metaverse, this received numerous interested parties during our workshop, and feels in-line with OMI efforts and values. 
- What would blogging look like? https://github.com/omigroup/website/discussions/53
- DO WE WANT TO ADD TWO CHAIRS TO START? We think we can make immediate impact by adding two more chairs, while we continue to evolve as a group. Ideally, these two would fill new roles and unlock new potential for our org, as well as, fill some of the existing gaps and overages. For clarity: This would yield 5 total chairs (which may change again as we go) We have been tracking the future structure of OMI with this milestone https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/milestone/2

Created blogging milestone in website group @antpb 
- website group milestones: https://github.com/omigroup/website/milestones?with_issues=no 
- first blog issue: https://github.com/omigroup/website/issues/54

![Screen Shot 2022-04-06 at 10 00 38 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1753624/162028411-904b85ba-be88-4bf2-838c-0c82fa603d8a.png)

## Agenda

- Volunteer to take notes? Volunteer to record? 
- Welcome newcomers

### Announcements and Updates
-  We had a retro! We will have another in a few weeks. Here are some key takeaways: 
    - We are on day 30 of 90 toward project leadership discussion and need to spend the next 30 days working through the milestone: [Future Structure of OMI](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/milestone/2)
    - We need more maintainers (see future structure of OMI) 
    - "Its initially hard to tell which groups do what, and how I can get involved. I have to guess based on the title of some of the working groups. Like Metatraversal sounds like something I would like but I can’t tell what it is." Evo will update the documentation for groups missing readmes like metatraversal and interoperator. Groups should ensure your discord and github channels clearly state how to get involved. Let's make it easier to get more contributors! 
    - Ant has some bandwidth to help shake things up at OMI, give live demos, spread the word, etc. 
    - lukecarbis called out that our calendar was only subscribable in google calendar format, and [submitted a PR](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/191#issuecomment-1061263395) to add other calendar formats. Supporters can now follow the OMI event calendar in other formats like ical. 

Working Group Updates:
-  OMI Website update
- OMI-Chan group
- Scripting group
- gLTF group
- any others?

Housekeeping:
Any?
- #176

Open Floor!
 
Please leave any additional agenda items below in the comments. Thanks!

## Last weeks retro summary

-  We had a retro! We will have another in a few weeks. Here are some key takeaways: 
    - We are on day 30 of 90 toward project leadership discussion and need to spend the next 30 days working through the milestone: [Future Structure of OMI](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/milestone/2)
    - We need more maintainers (see future structure of OMI) 
    - "Its initially hard to tell which groups do what, and how I can get involved. I have to guess based on the title of some of the working groups. Like Metatraversal sounds like something I would like but I can’t tell what it is." Evo will update the documentation for groups missing readmes like metatraversal and interoperator. Groups should ensure your discord and github channels clearly state how to get involved. Let's make it easier to get more contributors! 
    - Ant has some bandwidth to help shake things up at OMI, give live demos, spread the word, etc. 
    - lukecarbis called out that our calendar was only subscribable in google calendar format, and [submitted a PR](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/191#issuecomment-1061263395) to add other calendar formats. Supporters can now follow the OMI event calendar in other formats like ical. 

We will have another retro in a few weeks and try an alternative time to accommodate more OMI contributors. If you would like to have a retro for your working group, and want help, please reach out to me @mrmetaverse

### Announcements and Updates
• Interoperator starts on Friday at 9am PT

I'd like to propose use of the MIRO version of the Platform Design Toolkit for stakeholder mapping, incentives alignment with engagement mapping and the background community strategy work we'll need to do the next stage of work here at OMI. Using MIRO, this can be community facilitated over 1 long session or 2 shorter meeting times in March.

https://miro.com/miroverse/platform-design-toolkit/  -- not all of this canvas may be necessary for us as we are not creating a single platform, but a community of this type does exist to support each other and the whole as a network with related dynamics.

This is the next stage of the strategy roadmap & would also serve to outline aspects of Interoperators in terms of language structures/incentives/roles for participation with this community down the line.

We need to make some big picture decisions ahead for the long term resiliency of the open metaverse as well as for the support of this community.

Reminder, we created the OMI-Interoperator group (or at least voted to ratfiy the group) to conduct discovery and due diligence around what a partnership or affiliate program could look like with OMI. We want to ensure that we give this group time to form, and kick off, and be mindful not to step on their toes.

OMI-Chan group: 
- need to have a budget discussion 
- our budget is steadily growing and we feel this group could be a great place to allocate some budget towards things like art, avatars, etc. 
- What is expected from this group? Then we can meet to discuss allocation of some of our budget.

- omi audio emitter moves to phase 3, we have enough implementers now 
- antpb created a 3ov (three object viewer) component for Wordpress! It implements the omi-audio emitter as well!

We are tracking this effort with this milestone: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/milestone/2
Metatraversal could possibly use some guidance

What about another demo night? And have some time for a meta-traversal bit to raise more awareness around the convo. We also have multiple people in our community who have been demoing awesome open metaverse work lately. Antpb said we can count them in to speak.
What about another game-night field-trip day?

Suggestion: What about making a OMI place to meet work and hack? This was previously on our backlog, and antpb offered to resume the work. 

OMI Space to meet, work, and play #44

nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 41 is happening on Wednesday Feb 2nd, 2022 from 9:00 AM PDT - 10:00 AM PDT (17:00 UTC)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).
 
We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).

## Who we are and why we're here:

The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal. 

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

## Agenda

- Volunteer to take notes? Volunteer to record? 
- Welcome newcomers

### Announcements and Updates

  - Election is Today (scroll to bottom): https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/174
  - Proposed Change to Voting Rule : https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/175
  - Proposed minimum requirements for a working group to operate: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/176 
 - Updated Working agreement template: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/68
 - Omi-chan working group kicked off Saturday: https://github.com/omigroup/omi-chan
 - gLTF group updates 
 - WASM group updates 
 - backlog refinement kicked off last week (that's it no additional updates needed)

 - Open Floor!
 
Please leave any additional agenda items below in the comments. Thanks!
Wow! Check out this snapshot of some OMI-Chan avatar designs from the new [OMI-Chan working group](https://github.com/omigroup/omi-chan/discussions/13)!

Today we can vote to extend the existing terms by 90 days and commit to continuing to discover our new structure, or we can have the election as scheduled and commit to a new structure within 90 days. I defer to the group to make this decision with two votes if needed: 

Vote 1: Vote to extend existing chairs by 90 days 
Vote 2 (if vote 1 fails): Have the election as usual. 

I don't see any nominations so I assume the group wants the same chairs but we are all committed to dividing our responsibilities and creating new roles. I know I'm not alone when I say I want to do the right thing and find the best structure for all rather than just going through the motions. 

I will be on mountain today and may have shoddy service. I am honored to have served and to have a group like you to meet with, and would be honored to continue serving as chair. But, I will be committed to finding the right structure in the next 90 days, and I am tracking this effort with [this milestone: Future Structure of OMI](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/milestone/2)*

We are tracking the new structure effort with [this milestone](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/milestone/2)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63426722/152203754-97d0df6d-ab55-4e70-90f8-98411772a7c2.png)

VOTE 1: Extend existing chairs for 90 days and commit to discovering new structure 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63426722/152205181-24028d2a-3417-4e42-9552-5ca30bf25f10.png)

Vote 2: Vote to change voting to rules to accommodate attendance of working groups - PASSED
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63426722/152206570-4ab91780-c285-4541-b799-b7f65af0ad7b.png)

We discussed minimum requirements for a working group, and the provision of templates for things like readme's and working agreements. The group will continue to discuss async and pick up the convo next week. What do we want the minimum reqs to be? 

Robert also suggested making these issues PR's instead of issues.
OMI-Chan kicked off this past weekend. We discussed their work and reviewed their readme and working agreement as exemplars of a good kickoff.
gLTF group has great updates. One including that two members of the group attended a Khronos group today to share our work and process.

WASM Group: 
- had a good discussion last meeting 
- working on coordinating around a minimum viable piece of estate transferred between a runtime and WebAssembly context 
- reviewed what webassembly is, we are trying to explore a way various runtimes can be scriptable using a format called WebAssembly. 
- This takes a game engine like Unity or Godot and embeds a runtime that can interpret a format that would be common across all of these runtimes to create some portable script or business logic that can be usable by any game engine and some sliver of the metaverse can exist. 
- MVProject is some boolean state that can set collide to false in some object in the game universe. 
- group is going off into their corners and experimenting to implement tiny demos

Rick shared his notes from today as well: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63426722/152211826-89025939-55f3-4b38-b11a-390258c23474.png)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).

## Who we are and why we're here:

The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal. 

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

## Agenda

- Volunteer to take notes? Volunteer to record? 
- Welcome newcomers
- working groups check in: 
  - [website group](https://github.com/omigroup/website)
  - [gLTF working group](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions)
  - [WASM working group](https://github.com/omigroup/omi-wasm-group)

### Announcements and Updates

- What does future structure look like Master discussion
  - New Roles in OMI discussion
  - Discuss a hackathon as a group: #173 
  - Backlog refinement session recap: #172
 - Open Floor!
 
Please leave any additional agenda items below in the comments. Thanks!
We had our first backlog refinement session: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/172
Created a proposal on behalf of Evo to discuss a hackathon as a group: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/173

Are you familiar with our milestones system? 
[![Screenshot_20220126-084531](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63426722/151174199-eea139e8-cd07-4751-9da4-bf97b58bdcee.png)](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/milestones)
No volunteers to record, so this session will be only notes.
Rick will be taking their usual notes and adding here, I will also do my best to add notes as per usual.

# RE: Website group 

Want to help out? We are seeking images of our community in the Metaverse. Selfies with your group / friends in the metaverse, etc. 
- add here: https://airtable.com/shrZAsV1MA5QJctYx

Website has been updated to match the figma design. Still need to update some things like hover-state. We are ready to go live, and iterate from there. Pull request to come. 

also this pull request: https://github.com/omigroup/website/pull/49

One other creative way of helping is to photoshop, or take a selfie of your different avatars into a single shot. Help people understand a need for interoperability by demonstrating visually the challenges of traversing across the metaverse as different avatars. If you want to submit a group photo, just make sure the background can be cut out if needed. White, or greenscreen, or clear bg is preferred.

# RE: gLTF working group 

- last weeks agenda is available here: https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions/discussions/51 
- tomorrows agenda: https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions/discussions/52 
- tomorrow group will review pull request for audio emitter which is pretty much ready to go 
- beginning new spec for colliders and basic physics in gLTF objects (collision boxes, areas for triggered events, specify objects as static bodies for physics or dynamic bodies, etc. Once together we can add basic physics and collision detection in gLTF scenes which will enhance worlds, items, avatars, etc.) Overlapping potentially with WASM group. 
- This group is always looking to grow and meets on Thursdays at 22:30 UTC

# RE: WASM Group 

Defining scope, and getting aligned around what Web Assembly does. 
Spoke recently about APIs and integrating with WASM. discussed programming languages, etc. 
No agenda last time but working on that. 

Alternating between sessions with an agenda, versus more of a show and tell style. (great example of different working agreements and meeting styles!) 

Next week Nova is presenting Stardust! 

Input messages, how high level we want to be, and discussing pain points in other engines with dynamic scripting. The week after we will have another structured talk with an agenda. It's loose for now, and still taking shape. If you want to help steer where we are taking this, now is probably the time. 

We have a github discussion where we are tracking [Use Cases](https://github.com/omigroup/omi-wasm-group/discussions/13)

Hoping to narrow or refine scope and draft early user stories to help define and track the work.

# RE: Elections x Future structure
- next election is next week 2/2 
- We are not locked in, if we need to make changes to the OMI structure during the next term to the overall OMI structure, we can and will. We should not brush this conversation under the rug until next next election. 
- You can nominate chairs in [this new issue](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/174) 
- Tracking all of this in this Milestone: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/milestone/2
- The new structure of OMI proposed discussion: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/157
- OMI responsibilities Audit: https://hackmd.io/@mrmetaverse/omi-tasks-audit 
- Potential New Roles as a result of the responsibilities audit: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/165 
- Review our **core values**, as they help define our structure: 
  - We collaborate, driven by research, privacy and accessibility, to make the metaverse more human.
  - We work incrementally, iteratively, and with intent.
  - We are creating a cooperative, sustainable culture of innovation.
  - We empower the people making the metaverse.
  - We must cultivate resiliency by championing diversity, and freedom of choice.

# RE: Potential future Hackathon 

Evo is AFK so I am doing my best to track notes [here](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/173)

Rick took notes today: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63426722/151220654-0e971d6e-953b-4f25-a856-dc82ecbc941c.png)

The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal.

## Agenda

- Volunteer to take notes? Volunteer to record? 
- Welcome newcomers
- working groups check in: 
  - [website group](https://github.com/omigroup/website)
  - [gLTF working group](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions)
  - [WASM working group](https://github.com/omigroup/omi-wasm-group)

### Announcements and Updates
- Website discussion consensus on platform. @antpb has built a proof of concept that you can get the link and credentials to access in the #omi-website chanel. The demo site there was built in WordPress. If there is no opposition to going with this platform Anthony's will grant folks access and his company is willing to donate the server hosting and management to OMI if helpful. This means next step would be finishing out the site content and pointing a domain to the IP Anthony provides.
- What does future structure look like Master discussion
  - New Roles in OMI discussion
- Open Floor!
 
Please leave any additional agenda items below in the comments. Thanks!

I'd like to get a consensus on what platform to use for our website.
I'd also like to put out an open call for any and all content submissions to put on the website. Looking for primarily some avatars from the community. These avatars would be used as imagery to further spruce up the design, for instance: 
![Echoparadigm Edit - Extended, w pics and core value cards](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10410478/150033036-bf613c43-2c9d-4513-833c-1e93484609e4.png)

But also open to any and all submissions (articles, projects, videos, audio, images, etc) to be linked through or uploaded to the website. 

All media can be submitted here: https://airtable.com/shrZAsV1MA5QJctYx

On another note, I'd like to propose that instead of electing new chairs, we instead take the list of chair responsibilities and break it up into discrete tasks that anybody from the community can assign themselves to do. This would solve the problem of unsustainable workload falling on the leaders, make it easier for new/old members to see exactly what they can do to get involved and contribute, as well as create more clear/open space for accountability + gratitude for the work people are doing here.
This can be a 3-month 'sprint' for us to test how well (or not) this method of organizing works.

- [1/12/21 Sync Agenda and Notes](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/161)
- [New Roles in OMI discussion](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/165)
- [What does future structure look like Master discussion](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/157)
There's interest in exploring best fit events for 2022 strategy such as hackathons - do we have interest in partnered hackathons with others and taking a leadership role in helping make that happen?

Regarding async work and working groups. We have different groups, with di

https://hackmd.io/@mrmetaverse/omi-github-process

- OMI Github [Backlog Refinement](https://github.com/orgs/omigroup/projects/2#card-75916543): Meets the fourth Tuesday of every month at 22:05 - 22:50 UTC (contact Jesse @mrmetaverse)

Yasan made a great point. In other countries many people think that the Metaverse is owned by Facebook. They asked if we have a communications working group, and suggested that we could spread the word about the metaverse and how it is not owned by one company. This is directly related to our efforts, and is a thing we discuss often as a group. :) Evo suggested "Let's set a time to make a collaborative story weavers session together, and create a regular cadence for the communications group to meet."

Q: How can we get up to date on gLTF to become contributors? 
- https://www.khronos.org/gltf/ 
  - Check out their blog posts
  - past talks on youtube
- In order to be helpful at the working group level, either be an expert in a specific domain (like an engine, or 3d modeling package), then there are also people who know a lot about the gLTF specification process itself. We want to ensure our work is accurate to the official gltf specification, and then also ensure that it is useful for real world applications.

nodes.title: New Roles in OMI and a Call For Volunteers
nodes.body:
Hey everyone 👋 As discussed in our meeting today, we think there could be more volunteer roles for people looking to get more involved in OMI. We have an election coming up on February 2nd and we'd like to get feedback from the community on how we'd like to proceed as a group. Based on the [task list Jesse and I compiled](https://hackmd.io/bDrL7EC6THSEU_RU7SsNXw), here are some positions that I think might fit us better than 3 general chairs. I think one person should be able to hold multiple of these roles. Currently the 3 chairs handle a couple of these responsibilities at a time, but breaking it out into more roles allows us to better delegate responsibilities.

## Leadership Proposal:

### Steering Committee (3-5?):
  - Handles inbound partnership opportunities and reaches out to potential partners to further OMI's mission
  - Made up of a group of people who can speak on behalf of OMI on various topics
  - Communicates new partnership opportunities with the group and represents them when talking to prospective partners
  - Responsible for managing OMI's budget and assets based on the decisions set out by the group
  - Responsible for ensuring GitHub issues/discussions dealing with partnerships, budget, or organization responsibilities are brought to the group's attention and are resolved.

### General Meeting Moderators (2-3):
 - Helps create the agenda with the other moderators
 - Runs through the agenda
 - Moderates the call:
   - Manages speaker queue when necessary
   - Ensures people are given their time to speak
   - Invites others to join in on the conversation
   - Mutes users if they are having microphone issues
   - Enforces our Code of Conduct during the call
   - Runs votes during the call
 - Responsible for ensuring the meeting is recorded and notes are being taken. They don't have to be the ones taking notes/recording but they do need to make sure it's happening and they are distributed publicly.
 - Regularly runs retrospective meetings to check in on the health of our community
 - Responsible for ensuring GitHub issues/discussions dealing with new proposals for events, working groups, or other work items are brought to the group's attention and resolved.
 
### Working Group Chairs (1-2 per group):
  - Same as the general meeting but applied to individual working groups
  - Also responsible for adhering to the W3C process and ensuring that proper IP protection policies are followed
  - Listed under the W3C metaverse-interop group as chairs
  - Responsible for moderating and organizing the working group's GitHub

### Social Media Manager:
  - Our public voice for OMI on social media
  - Sends out updates on meetings, events, and projects happening within our communities
  - Creates and maintains content that is in line with our community's values
  
### Event Manager: 
  - Helps schedule and run regularly occurring events within our community
  - Examples include Demo Days, Twitter Spaces, Hackathons, Field Trips, etc.
  
### Discord Moderators (as many as we want):
  - Welcomes new users and helps them find their way in the community
  - Enforces our Code of Conduct throughout the server

## Summary

In summary, I think we still need a leadership body. I think that we should continue to divide those responsibilities and power. I think that a steering committee will be able to handle these outward facing interactions with other organizations that require us to have one or two people speaking on behalf of the group at a time. This comes up when responding to press, speaking opportunities, and in negotiating partnerships.

I think we should split up the other tasks the chairs and other members of our community have taken on into explicit roles which I've outlined above. I'm not sure that these encompass everything we need yet, but it's what I can come up with now and I'd love to hear from all of you on how you might structure this differently.

**If you are interested in filling one of these roles, please nominate yourself here! We'd love the help!**

Please, if you have time to chime in on this subject, do so before our next meeting on January 19th so we can discuss this then.

Thanks everyone!

Oh, also I think we should separate the Steering Committee roles from W3C chairs. This will better allow us to take on leaders who do not feel comfortable with the W3C chairing process which requires a legal identity versus allowing for anonymous participants. We have a few people within this community who value their privacy and yet are trusted members of our community who should not have to be excluded from leadership opportunities.

I think W3C chairs should be reserved for chairs of the respective sub-groups where specifications are being authored as they align better with what W3C really does.

OMI as an org can then operate independently from W3C and only use W3C as an umbrella for specifications, etc.

+1 to Robert's reply on Steering Committee sub-group affiliation
+ non-identity requirements.

On Wed, Jan 12, 2022 at 3:03 PM Robert Long ***@***.***>
wrote:

> Oh, also I think we should separate the Steering Committee roles from W3C
> chairs. This will better allow us to take on leaders who do not feel
> comfortable with the W3C chairing process which requires a legal identity
> versus allowing for anonymous participants. We have a few people within
> this community who value their privacy and yet are trusted members of our
> community who should not have to be excluded from leadership opportunities.
>
> I think W3C chairs should be reserved for chairs of the respective
> sub-groups where specifications are being authored as they align better
> with what W3C really does.
>

> or Android

>
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.Message
> ID: ***@***.***>
>

Echoing the above in Roberts proposal, no one person should feel bound to only one role. Everyone should also feel able to step down and back in as they are comfortable and available.

With the extensions group as an example I could see chairs volunteering themselves as maintainers of certain components to give updates in meetings and verify process and stages of an extension lifecycle. Audio Emitter has been naturally taking shape. That's one component for instance I personally would be comfortable maintaining and shepherding implementations going forward. I think as more glTF extensions are added the group will need much more help organizing the different stages of proposals and implementations. All of those processes can come with time as we learn more about the role in practice, but that is one area I think would need 2 or more folks as chair representation to start. These reps should make it a goal of the term to document the tips/responsibilities for the next election. (something I'd feel eager and comfortable taking on for gltf-extensions if it makes sense and is agreed by the group 😄  )

I think one way to avoid perceived power and a need for term limits would be to give a cool title to people that have served in a role and stepped down. They helped make the metaverse more open and they should be able to celebrate that without having to hold a position.

If I may comment, the individual responsibilities seem to great for volunteers like us who only have limited time due to work. For example, I would be willing to run some meetings but I can't do them all since sometimes work interferes time-wise. My suggestion would be to specify limited roles for those who love the vision but can't put in the same amount of time the founders do.
"General Meeting Moderators" I'd be willing to volunteer to lead a meeting 1/2 times per month if some previsions can be made in case of emergency.

I'd like to propose that instead of electing new chairs, we instead take the list of chair responsibilities and break it up into discrete tasks that anybody from the community can assign themselves to do. This would solve the problem of unsustainable workload falling on the leaders, make it easier for new/old members to see exactly what they can do to get involved and contribute, as well as create more clear/open space for accountability + gratitude for the work people are doing here.
This can be a 3-month 'sprint' for us to test how well (or not) this method of organizing works.

nodes.title: 01/12/21 Weekly Meeting 38 Agenda
nodes.body:
Weekly Meeting 38 is happening on Wednesday January 12th, 2022 from 9:00 AM PDT - 10:00 AM PDT (17:00 UTC)

You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t).
 
We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E).

## Who we are and why we're here:

The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal. 

If you’re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help!

We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals.

## Agenda

- Volunteer to take notes? Volunteer to record? 
- Welcome newcomers

### Announcements and Updates

- WASM Meeting, how did it go? Would any participant like to represent the group and give a summary?
- Next website meeting is on Tuesday, January 18th
- OMI-Chan status?
- We have a discussion (and milestone) around the future of OMI. We should discuss what that could look like. Started listing known tasks and responsibilities which could help inform future chair structure, working groups, operations, etc. We want to properly divide workload to reduce bottlenecks and improve sustainability. **++ On that note, next election is 2/2/22**
- From @LightLodges: discussions/milestones = EVENTS and community driven engagement strategies including cadence and what we're ready to aim for in budgets/planning. Let's talk events!
- OMI glTF extensions group update

Please leave any additional agenda items below in the comments. Thanks!

+ check in with gltf group 
+ OMI-Chan status? 
+ Interoperators effort set for possibly this Friday (Evo) 
+ Backlog refinement public meeting every 3rd Tuesday of month at 22:05UTC 
+ Updated readme to reflect working groups, ensure your group is up to date with link to repo and time you meet (if appropriate) 
+ We have a discussion (and milestone) around the future of OMI. We should discuss what that could look like. Started listing known tasks and responsibilities which could help inform future chair structure, working groups, operations, etc. We want to properly divide workload to reduce bottlenecks and improve sustainability. 
++ On that note, next election is 2/2/22

Agenda item related to discussions/milestones = EVENTS and community driven engagement strategies including cadence and what we're ready to aim for in budgets/planning.

Streams - regularly? Weekly?
Demos - quarterly? Next one in March?
Hackathons - April? June or July partnered events with others?

There's interest in partnering up to make sure the hackathons start to happen by spring. Are we do to partner up with others engaged in hackathon building for interop and WebXR for spring and summer, and do we have a clear sense of how those relationships need to work for everyone to benefit?

WASM group update: 

- https://github.com/omigroup/omi-wasm-group/discussions/9
- Next meeting is next Tuesday 
- Hope you will get involved

Website: 

- Robert got a first draft finished last week

Future structure of OMI: Very important conversation to be had as a group before next election. Do we need more chairs, new ways of dividing work? 

Notes on known responsibilities of OMI leadership: https://hackmd.io/@mrmetaverse/omi-tasks-audit 

How might we use this list (and add to it) to codify potential roles for the future structure?

RE: From @LightLodges: discussions/milestones = EVENTS and community driven engagement strategies including cadence and what we're ready to aim for in budgets/planning. Let's talk events!

- expand our open community events 
- help people find out what the open metaverse is working on and how to get involved 
- showing up in others communities 
- inviting people in to our community
- possibly physical meetings as well
- hackathons, etc. 
- Metatraversal III
  - Next meetup for that is happening tomorrow (Thursday 18:30 UTC ) for questions ping Evo on Discord :) 
  - identity management, avatar solutions, questions around metatraversal that require conversation and not assumptions 
- Where do you think we should be putting our attention in terms of education and development 
  
past events: [OMI Interoperability Demo Night](https://youtu.be/e26UJRCGfGk)

New updates for Audio emitter explainer, new PR available. 
- list contributors 
- next meeting is Thursday at 22:30UTC - 23:30UTC
- ex of a great way to share utility for a PR that OMI puts out: https://github.com/mozilla/hubs/pull/4741#issuecomment-1004431004 (see comments)

nodes.title: WASM - Godot Engine scripting
nodes.body:
@AdamFrisby

Godot Engine works on 5-10 platforms and has a scripting language called gdscript. One of the platforms is WASM. I wanted to investigate using jitasm for gdscript.

Since I wanted to try using gdscript for wasm, as a sandboxing layer, here are some questions.

Can we generate wasm in wasm and have the wasm called?

Here's a chat log with the asmjit community:

**kobalicek**: (Petr Kobalicek)
   you would be basically generating wasm code from wasm code, and wanting wasm code to call that generated wasm code
   I have no idea whether it's possible or not
**iFire**
    I have a feeling it is, but I'm new to this.
**kobalicek (Petr Kobalicek)**
    to me it seemed that emscripten would just create one "statically" linked wasm archive
**iFire**
    it would be similar to a shared library?
**kobalicek (Petr Kobalicek)**
    I mean the way asmjit works, you can generate a single function, for example, I'm not sure how this would work in wasm - because when running asmjit natively, that generated function can access memory of the process - if you create a wasm function, would it have access to wasm code loaded by javascript, for example?
    What I mean is, how would that wasm code even reference another wasm code?
    is it possible to free that wasm code, etc
    because if you think of it, when running natively, you can do all sorts of stuff, allocate executable memory, fill it with code, execute it, change it, free it, etc
     have no idea about how restricted wasm is to be honest
    not sure it would even be complicated to generate it, I think the tooling around it would be more difficult than generating the bytecode

It's possible yeah, just be aware that sandboxing any code that way might be a painful exercise (if you need the sub wasm running at a lower privilege level with discrete memory)

One route if you do need that sandboxing would be to emscripten compile something like wasmtime. Otherwise you can load the modules into the main space at runtime easily enough.
________________________________

To: omigroup/omigroup ***@***.***>
Cc: Adam Frisby ***@***.***>; Mention ***@***.***>
Subject: [omigroup/omigroup] WASM - Godot Engine scripting (Discussion #160)


@AdamFrisby<https://github.com/AdamFrisby>

Godot Engine works on 5-10 platforms and has a scripting language called gdscript. One of the platforms is WASM. I wanted to investigate using jitasm for gdscript.

Since I wanted to try using gdscript for wasm, as a sandboxing layer, here are some questions.

Can we generate wasm in wasm and have the wasm called?

Here's a chat log with the asmjit community:

kobalicek: (Petr Kobalicek)
you would be basically generating wasm code from wasm code, and wanting wasm code to call that generated wasm code
I have no idea whether it's possible or not
iFire
I have a feeling it is, but I'm new to this.
kobalicek (Petr Kobalicek)
to me it seemed that emscripten would just create one "statically" linked wasm archive
iFire
it would be similar to a shared library?
kobalicek (Petr Kobalicek)
I mean the way asmjit works, you can generate a single function, for example, I'm not sure how this would work in wasm - because when running asmjit natively, that generated function can access memory of the process - if you create a wasm function, would it have access to wasm code loaded by javascript, for example?
What I mean is, how would that wasm code even reference another wasm code?
is it possible to free that wasm code, etc
because if you think of it, when running natively, you can do all sorts of stuff, allocate executable memory, fill it with code, execute it, change it, free it, etc
because if you think of it, when running natively, you can do all sorts of stuff, allocate executable memory, fill it with code, execute it, change it, free it, etc
have no idea about how restricted wasm is to be honest
not sure it would even be complicated to generate it, I think the tooling around it would be more difficult than generating the bytecode

Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/160>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAA326JVK5EYGTNVKGAR5EDUU5BXVANCNFSM5LPRM5FA>.
Triage notifications on the go with GitHub Mobile for iOS<https://apps.apple.com/app/apple-store/id1477376905?ct=notification-email&mt=8&pt=524675> or Android<https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.github.android&referrer=utm_campaign%3Dnotification-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_source%3Dgithub>.
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.***>

WASM at the end of the day is just bytecode like the native gdscript. Sandboxing it inside the engine specially can be tricky but is mainly a question about the ABI. so something like WASMER is good to extend godot with a WASM sandbox. but keep in mind it will still be able to do everything inside the engine like any other script. Godot has no Node security system.

The issue with sandboxing is this is UGC, where content is likely loaded at runtime from untrusted sources. Some level of sandboxing should be considered essential, but you're right - wasmer et al can handle that job.

Something to discuss on the meeting next week.
